gurmukhi: nhI jrY nYk pwvk mMJwr ] borY n isMD soKY n bXwr ]5]130]
transliteration: Nahidarai Naik P3vak Manjhaar|| Borai Na Sindh Sokhai Na Bayaar||5||130||
translation: It is not burnt even in the fire. It is neither drowned in the sea nor soaked by the air.5.130.

gurmukhi: iek krXo pRsn Awqmw dyv ] AnBMg rUp AnBau AByv ]
transliteration: Ik Daryo Prasan Aatamaa Dev|| Anbhan Roop Anbhau Abhev||
translation: Then the Soul questioned the Lord thus : “O Lord! Thou art Invincible, Intuitive and Indiscriminate Entity;

gurmukhi: Xih cqur vrg sMswr dwn ] ikhu cqur vrg ikjY viKAwn ]6]131]
transliteration: Yah(i) Chatur Varag Sansar Daan|| Kih(u) Chatur Varag Kijai Vakhiaan||6||131||
translation: “This world mentions four categories of Charities; which are these categories, tell me Graciously.”6.131.

gurmukhi: iek rwju Drm iek dwn Drm ] iek Bog Drm iek moC krm ]
transliteration: Ik Raaj(u) Dharma Ik Daan Dharma|| Ik Bhog Dharma Ik Mochh Karam||
translation: One is political discipline, one is ascetic’s discipline; one is householder’s discipline, one is ascetic’s discipline.

gurmukhi: iek cqur vrg sB jg BxMq ] sy Awqmwh pRwqmw puCMq ]7]132]
transliteration: Ik Chatur Varag Sabh Jag Bhanant|| Se Aatamaah Praatamaa Pouchhant||7||132||
translation: All the world knows this one of four categories; that Soul makes enquiries from the Lord.7.132.

gurmukhi: iek rwj Drm iek Drm dwn ] iek Bog Drm iek moCvwn ]
transliteration: Ik Raaj Dharma Ik Dharma Daan|| Ik Bhog Dharam Ik Mochhvaan||
translation: One is political discipline and one is religious discipline; one is householder’s discipline, one is ascetic’s discipline .

gurmukhi: qum kho cqR cqRy ibcwr ] jy qiRkwl Bey jug Apwr ]8]133]
transliteration: Toum Kaho Chatra Chatre Bichaar|| Je Trikaal Bhae Joug Apaar||8||133||
translation: Tell me Graciously Thy thoughts about all the four: and also tell me their originators in long ages in three epochs.8.133.

gurmukhi: brnMn kro qum piRQm dwn ] ijm dwn Drm ikMny niRpwn ]
transliteration: Barnann Daro Toum Pritham Daan|| Jim Daan Dharma Kinne Nripaan||
translation: Describe to me the first discipline; how this religious discipline was observed by the kings.

gurmukhi: siqjug krm sur dwn dMq ] BUmwid dwn kIny AkMQ ]9]134]
transliteration: Sat(i)joug Karam Sur Daan Dant|| Bhoomaadh Daan Keene Akanth||9||134||
translation: In Satyuga charities were given by performing virtuous actions; indescribable charities of lands etc;, were given.9.134.

gurmukhi: qRY jug mhIp brny n jwq ] gwQw AnMq aupmw Agwq ]
transliteration: Trai Joug Maheep Barne Na Jaat|| Gadthaa Anant Oupmaa Agadt||
translation: It is difficult to describe the king of three ages, their story is endless and the Praise indescribable.

gurmukhi: jo kIey jgq mY j`g Drm ] brny n jwih qy Aimq krm ]10]135]
transliteration: Jo Keee Jagad Mai Jagg Dharma|| Barne Na Jah(i) Te Amit Karam||10||135||
translation: By performing sacrifices, the religious discipline unlimited action.10.135.

gurmukhi: kiljug qy Awid jo Bey mhIp ] ieih BrQ KMif mih jMbU dIp ]
transliteration: Kalijoug Te Aadh Jo Bhae Maheep|| Eh(i) Bharath Khand(i) Maih Janboo Deep||
translation: The kings that reigned before Kaliyuga, in the Jambu Dvipa in the Bharat Khand.

gurmukhi: qÍ bl pRqwp brxO su qRYx ] rwjw XuiDstr BU BrQ eyx ]11]136]
transliteration: Tva Bal Prataap Barnau Su Train|| Raajaa Yudhistar Bhoo Bharth En||11||136||
translation: I describe them with Thy Strength and Glory, The king Yadhishtra was the unblemished Sustainer of the earth.11.136.

gurmukhi: KMfy AKMf ijh cqur KMf ] kYroN kurKyqR mwry pRcMf ]
transliteration: Khande Akhannddjih Chatur Khand|| Kairon Kurkhetra Mdare Prachanndd||
translation: He (Yadhishtra) broke the unbreakable ones in the four khands (regions), He destroyed the Kauravas with great might in the war of Kurukshetra.
